citation.biblCit: Štebe, J., Bezjak, S., Lužar, S. and Vipavc Brvar, I. (2016). Open Data: Situation, Issues and Responsibility for Taking Care of Data [Data file]. Ljubljana: Univerza v Ljubljani = University of Ljubljana, Arhiv družboslovnih podatkov = Social Science Data Archives. ADP - IDNo: ODPP11. https://doi.org/10.17898/ADP_ODPP11_V1

subject.topcClas: searching, accessing and reusing the data
selection, valuation of quality and usability of data

stdyInfo.abstract: Open data project provided an overview of situation regarding taking care of research data in Slovenia. Issues, procedures and solutions were identified in the various phases of data life cycle: creation, evaluation, curation, publication and use of research data. The experiences and specifics of different actors from various institutions were applied to prepare a national plan and conclusions on this field. For this purpose 22 interviews were conducted with Slovenian experts from various scientific fields who act as producers, curators or users of the data. The main focus of interest was to find out what are the potentials for the future. Besides examining current situation in Slovenia, one of the major objectives in the first phase of this project was an attempt to identify better and upgraded future system for accessing research data.

sumDscr.universe: Essential requirement was to cover various scientific disciplines and to get acquainted with different phases of research data life cycle. To achieve this goal, a list of participants from various research fields, including natural sciences, engineering, social sciences and humanities and with different experiences of research data management, i.e. data creators, curators or users, was created.

dataCollector.affiliation: Univerza v Ljubljani = University of Ljubljana

dataColl.dataCollector: Arhiv družboslovnih podatkov = Social Science Data Archives
dataColl.sampProc: A meeting with representatives of research institutes, which was organized in January 2011 by the Ministry of Higher Education, Science and Technology, was the first step in the selection of the interviewees. All thirty participants of the meeting, left their contact details and were chosen as potential candidates for collaboration in the project. Other candidates were sought through desk research or through personal acquaintances and the recommendations from others. The list of 85 potential candidates who were interested for collaboration was formed. In the end 47 candidates, covering different research areas, were chosen to be contacted. After a written invitation, some of them rejected collaboration, some were left out, when a quota of representatives of their research field was fulfilled and some participants were additionally included on the basis of recommendations.
dataColl.cleanOps: Data was cleaned.. By making transtcripts from audio records, typing errors and basic spelling mistakes were cleaned.

method.stdyClas: 5 - pilot studies that create or improve the instrument and conceptualisation of a new area

setAvail.accsPlac: Arhiv družboslovnih podatkov = Social Science Data Archives

useStmt.restrctn: Data and materials are licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License. The users should use the materials only for the purposes specified in Registration form, to act at all times so as to preserve the confidentiality of individuals and institutions recorded in the materials.
useStmt.contact: Arhiv družboslovnih podatkov = Social Science Data Archives
useStmt.citReq: The users should acknowledge in any publication both the original depositors and the Archive.
useStmt.deposReq: Users are requested to deposit with the Archive two copies of any published work or report based wholly or in part on such materials and to notify the Archive of any errors discovered in the materials.
useStmt.conditions: In case of ambiguity the users of the data set are advised to contact principal investigators or Archive.
